en: And king Solomon was king over all Israel.
hmr: Lal Solomon chu Israelhai po po chungah lalin a um tah a.

en: And these were the princes whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;
hmr: Hienghai hi a mi lien neihai chu an nih: Zadok naupa Azaria chu thiempu a na, Sisa naupahai Eliho- reph le Ahija chu lekha ziektu an na,

en: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder;
hmr: Ahilud naupa Jehosaphat chu chanchin ziektu a na.

en: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;
hmr: Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu sipai hotu a na; Zadok le Abiathar chu thiempu an nih;

en: and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers; and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister, and the king’s friend;
hmr: Nathan naupa Azaria chu hotu- hai chunga mi a na; Nathan naupa Zabud chu thiempu le lal ruolpa a na,

en: and Ahishar was over the household; and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the men subject to taskwork.
hmr: Ahisar chu insûng tieng hotu a na; Abda naupa Adoniram chu sin- thawa ruoi luihai hotu a nih.

en: And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided victuals for the king and his household: each man had to make provision for a month in the year.
hmr: Solomon chun Israel po pohai chunga chun hotu sâwmpahni a nei a, chuonghai chun lal ta ding le a sûngkuohai ta ding chun fâk ding an ngaituo hlak a, mi pakhatin kum khatah thla khat pei fâk ding a ngaituo ding a nih.

en: And these are their names: Ben-hur, in the hill-country of Ephraim;
hmr: Chun, hieng hi an hminghai chu a nih: Ephraim tlâng ramah Ben-hur;

en: Ben-deker, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan;
hmr: Makaz khuoa dâm, Saalbim khuoa dâm, Beth-semes khuoa dâm, Elonbeth-hanan khuoa dâm chun Ben-dekar a na;

en: Ben-hesed, in Arubboth (to him pertained Socoh, and all the land of Hepher);
hmr: Aruboth rama chun Ben-hesed a na, ama chun Soko le Hepher ram po po a chang sah a;

en: Ben-abinadab, in all the height of Dor (he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife);
hmr: Dor zosâng ram po poah, Ben-abinadab a na; ama chun Solomon naunu Taphath chu nu- hmeiah a nei a;

en: Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;
hmr: Taanak khuo le Megiddo khuoa dâm, Jezreel khaw hnuoi Zarethan khaw bula um Beth-sean biel po poa dâm, Beth-seana inthawka Abel- meholah-a dâm, Jokmeam ram dep chenin Ahilud naupa Baana a na;

en: Ben-geber, in Ramoth-gilead (to him pertained the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; even to him pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brazen bars);
hmr: Ramoth-gilead khuoah Ben- geber, ama chun Manasse naupa Jair khuo, Gilead rama umhai chu a chang sah a; Basan rama Argob biel, khaw ropuitak tak khaw sâwmruk, kul le a kalna dâr tluon neihai khawm a chang sah a;

en: Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;
hmr: Mahanaim khuoah Iddo naupa Ahinadab a na;

en: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali (he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon to wife);
hmr: Naphtali ramah Ahimaz a na; ama khawm chun Solomon naunu Basemath chu nuhmeiah a nei a;

en: Baana the son of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;
hmr: Aser le Bealoth khuohaia chun Husai naupa Baana a na;

en: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar;
hmr: Issakar ramah Parua naupa Jehosaphat a na;

en: Shimei the son of Ela, in Benjamin;
hmr: Benjamin ramah Ela naupa Simei a na;

en: Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer that was in the land.
hmr: Amorhai lal Sihon le Basan lal Og ram Gilead ramah Uria naupa Geber; chu rama chun hotu pakhat a um.

en: Judah and Israel were many as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry.
hmr: Judahai le Israelhai chu tui- suoriet pang ṭieu phaiphin zât zetin an tam a: an fâkin an dâwn a, hlimtakin an um hlak a.

en: And Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River unto the land of the Philistines, and unto the border of Egypt: they brought tribute, and served Solomon all the days of his life.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Vadunga inthawkin Philistin mihai ram le Aigupta ramri chenin ram po po chunga chun ro a rêl a; lâwm- manhai an hung chawi hlak a, Solomon dam sûng po chun a rawng an bâwl hlak a.

en: And Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal,
hmr: Solomon ni khat fâk khawp chu beiphit inditak tekhâwng sâwmthum le, beiphit narân tekhâwng sâwmruk a nih;

en: ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, besides harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fatted fowl.
hmr: chun, bâwngchal thâutak sâwm, bâwngchal tla mi sâwmhni leh, berâm za leh, chuong naw khawm chu sakhihai dâm, sangaihai dâm, sakhi chalhai dâm, âr châwm thâuhai leh a nih.

en: For he had dominion over all the region on this side the River, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, over all the kings on this side the River: and he had peace on all sides round about him.
hmr: Vadung râltieng ram po po, Tipsaa inthawka Gaza chenin; Va- dung râla lalhai po po chunga chun ân lal a; a vêla mihai po po le chun râlmuongin an um hlak a.

en: And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig-tree, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, all the days of Solomon.
hmr: Chun, Solomon dam sûng po chun Judahai le Israelhai chu Dana inthawka Beer-seba khuo chenin mi tin mâni grêphrui bula le mâni thei- chang kûng bula chun lungmuong- takin an um seng a.

en: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun a tawlailîr siena dingin sakawr in sîng li le, sakawr chung chuong mi sîng khat le sâng hni a nei a.

en: And those officers provided victuals for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon’s table, every man in his month; they let nothing be lacking.
hmr: Chuong hotuhai chun mâni chan thla peiah Solomon le lal Solomon dawkâna hung awt vetuhai po po fâk ding chu an ngaituo hlak a; pêk kim lo an nei ngai nawh.

en: Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds brought they unto the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.
hmr: Mi tinin an thaw dinga ruot ang peiin an umna ding hmuna chun sakawrhai le ran tlân hrâttakhai ta dingin buṭei le bupâwlhai an hung siekhâwl hlak a.

en: And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea-shore.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Solomon chu varna le hrietna nasatak le, lungril lienna tuisuoriet panga ṭieu phaiphin ang el a pêk a.

en: And Solomon’s wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east, and all the wisdom of Egypt.
hmr: Solomon varna chun khawsak nauhai po po varna le Aigupta mihai varna po po chu a khûm vawng a.

en: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all the nations round about.
hmr: Mi po po nêkin a var lem a; Mahol nauhai, Ezra mi Ethan hai, Heman hai, Kalkol hai, Darda hai nêk khawmin; chuongchun, a vêl hnam po po lai chun a hming ân thang tah a.

en: And he spake three thousand proverbs; and his songs were a thousand and five.
hmr: Thuvarhai sâng thum a hril a; chun, a hlahai chu sâng khat le panga a nih.

en: And he spake of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall; he spake also of beasts, and of birds, and of creeping things, and of fishes.
hmr: Thing chanchin hai khawm, Lebanon tlânga sidar thinga in- thawka kula hung ṭo suok hussop chenin a hril hlak a; sa chanchin dâm, vate chanchin dâm, bawkinvâka lâwn mi chanchin dâm, nga chanchin dâm khawm a hril thei a.

en: And there came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon varna chanchin hre taphawthai chu khaw- vêla lalhai po poa inthawkin chi tina mi a varna ngai dingin an hung hlak a.
